clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For use in the treatment of allergic rhinitis hay fever and allergic skin disorders

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Diphenylpyraline is an antihistamine that prevents but does not reverse responses mediated by histamine alone Diphenylpyraline antagonizes most of the pharmacological effects of histamine including urticaria and pruritus Also diphenylpyraline may exhibit anticholinergic actions as do most of the antihistamines and may thus provide a drying effect on the nasal mucosa

incompatibilities.description: Diphenylpyraline may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent
The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Diphenylpyraline
Amphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Phentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Pseudoephedrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Benzphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Diethylpropion may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Lisdexamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Mephentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
MMDA may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Midomafetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
4 Bromo 2 5 dimethoxyamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Tenamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Chlorphentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Methylenedioxyethamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Dextroamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Metamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Iofetamine I 123 may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Ritobegron may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline

Methoxyphenamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
Gepefrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylthioamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Diphenylpyraline
The therapeutic efficacy of Pitolisant can be decreased when used in combination with Diphenylpyraline
The therapeutic efficacy of Norepinephrine can be increased when used in combination with Diphenylpyraline
